LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_DBR_SelectAnIte: Please select the preset you want to edit from the list below
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_DBR_Validate: If it is not a new preset and only "Set Priority" is checked, writing to JSON is possible
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_DBR_InputPreset: Please enter the image name without extension located in RimWorld/CustomPortraits
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_DBR_InputSamePr: This preset name already exists. Please choose a different one
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_DBRE_Error1: If not a new JSON, please fill in everything except Interactions
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_DBRE_Error2: Updating only Interactions is possible, but please fill in the "Select Interaction" tab
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_DBRE_Error3: Updating only Priority is possible, but please fill in the "Priority" tab
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_IFE_Desc1: This section summarizes how to manage names when pawns give or receive interactions such as chit-chat or insults
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_IFE_Desc2: By deciding something like "This is the name for the one who received the insult", you can later use this modifier (name) during group editing
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_IFE_Desc3: The reason this is not done in Group Editing is because interactions have both a sender and a receiver
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_IFE_Desc4: Unlike moods, it is not a single-person context but a two-party relationship.
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_IFE_Desc5: Depending on the mod, both sender and receiver may even be the same pawn
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_IFE_PleaseSelec: Please select one or more in the "Select Interaction" tab
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_IFE_InitiatorIn: Please enter the modifier for the sender side of this interaction:
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_IFE_RecipientIn: Please enter the modifier for the receiver side of this interaction:
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_IFE_EnterInitia: This is the cache time. Notification will not be sent until the conversation between the two pawns has finished
Also, if you switch portraits exactly at the end of a chit-chat, it will be too brief, so the user should set a cache time here
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_IFE_EditInterac: This section links the selections from the Interaction Selection list to sender/receiver names
Please select one or more and press the Confirm button
Please enter a summary name that groups this sender and receiver (either one is also possible):
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_IFE_EndEditting: This setup is complete. Please proceed to fill in other tabs with the current screen state
If there is an issue with the input, please choose "Return Without Saving"
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_IFE_ConfirmCach: The cache time differs, but they point to the same interaction name
Because this was manually written JSON, the later values will overwrite in this screen
It is recommended to back up InteractionFilter.json first
List of targets and values to be overwritten: Overwritten Cache Time ==>
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_GE_Desc1: This section groups pawn mood names and interaction names defined earlier
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_GE_Desc2: Without grouping, you would have to write image paths for every single mood and interaction, which would be very tedious
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_GE_Desc3: Since you probably cannot create such a huge number of images,
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_GE_Desc4: this allows you to bundle similar moods into one group name and link it with textures later
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_GE_Desc5: Please operate this screen after selecting one or more in the "Select Mood" tab or distributing them in the "Distribute Interactions" tab
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_GE_Desc7: Please distribute sender/receiver in "Distribute Interactions" tab before grouping
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_GE_Desc8: Please select one or more preset names to edit
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_GE_EditGroupDes: Select which mood names and interaction names to include in this group
Later, you will decide which texture to display with this group name
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_GE_EndEditingDe: This setup is complete. Please proceed to the "Select Portrait" tab
If there is an issue with the input, please choose "Return Without Saving"
Moods and Interactions included in this group:
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_PG_Desc2: Since moods etc. have been grouped in the previous step, here you link those group names with portraits
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_PG_Desc3: For example: use this portrait for chit-chat, use this portrait for insulted, etc.
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_PG_Desc4: If it’s an animation, only multiple DDS (DXT1) images are supported
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_PG_Desc5: If it’s not an animation, PNG or DDS (DXT1) images are supported
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_PG_Desc6: Please edit this tab after completing the "Grouping" tab
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_PG_EditPortrait: An already linked group exists, so the default value will be used here:
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_PG_EditIdlePort: This is the fallback portrait when no state is selected in the weight settings
Even if a mood image has a 99% probability, processing may miss it
This sets the portrait for when nothing is selected
Idle already exists, so the default value will be used here:
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_PG_EditDeadPort: When a pawn dies, moods are lost
Without this, no portrait can be displayed in dead state, so configure a portrait here
Dead already exists, so the default value will be used here:
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_PG_EndEditingDe: This setup is complete. Please proceed to the "Set Portrait Priority" tab
If there is an issue with the input, please choose "Return Without Saving"
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_PG_PortraitEdit: This is the base path for the portrait
After reloading JSON, images will be placed here
Please set the time for switching portraits when pawn states change
For animated images, enter from-to numbers
From is fixed at 1, to is the last image number (for 1.dds~79.dds, enter 79)
When showing a single image at state change
From is fixed at 1, to is not set. So place 1.dds or 1.png in "{PresetName}/{GroupName}/"
Please select the extension of the single image to display
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_PW_Desc2: Here you decide the display order of portraits depending on pawn states
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_PW_Desc3: For example: which to prioritize between State A and State B
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_PW_Desc4: Or how likely State A should be selected
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_PW_EndEditingDe: This setup is complete. Please return to the Dashboard and press the "Write to JSON" button
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_WJEW_Desc1: No errors detected. Please press Confirm button
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_WJEW_Desc2: This is the message displayed when an issue occurs after reloading JSON
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_WJEW_Desc3: Mostly this happens when preset images are missing. Check Player.log to see where it stopped
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_WJEW_Desc4: If errors other than missing textures occur, the preset cannot be read. Please manually fix or overwrite with backup folder and restart the game
LanguageData.Foxy.CustomPortraits.RCP_WJEW_Desc5: For detailed errors, please check "RCP Reload JSON And Check Errors"
